content.description: Climbs the northwest facing arete on the Goldy boulder. Stand start is the usual way but sit start can be done at V5.  Fun and harder than it looks.
content.location: The west (down canyon) end of the Goldy boulder, on the left side of a slabby outcropping.

content.description: There are actually two sit starts to the downclimb, but this one is the better one, on the right. Nestle down low, and sneak your feet onto good edges, grab decent holds, and power up right hand to a cool sloper on the arete. Work straight up from there - climbs smoothly! Wonderful line. You can finish on jugs on the downclimb, or for a different challenge, finish more to the right on a more technical mantel.
content.location: Just right of the Goldy downclimb, right on the rock that sits under the downclimb.

content.description: Very enjoyable climbing in and out of the tall splitting crack.
content.location: This boulder is further east of the Goldy Boulder; climb the wide, south-facing crack in view of the trail.

content.description: Grab the positive edges over the bulge to the left of Appollo and Edges.  High step and continue up edges to the arete and slab above.
content.location: Two routes left of Appollo, starts on edges over the bulge

content.description:
"Kind of like Feck, except it's falling apart as you go!"

From the BB - Start with chest height crimps a few feet right of the offwidth, move up and right on the gritty face.

Actually a pretty nice line, if you find the right features, watch out for choss!
content.location: On the S face of the off width on the face to the right of the crack

content.description: Nice warm up that connects butt on ground to top of downclimb. Recommended, on cool holds.
Head up the face to the left of Wacko Arete, cruise up past  crystal crimps to a sloper top out.
content.location: If walking towards the boulder from the main trail head to the right side.  This climbs the middle of the face to the left of Wacko Arete.

content.description: Starts on the jug on the left side of face a couple feet off the ground, and side pull on the right, big move to sloper and another from a pinch to the top-out.
content.location: Park in the Park-n-ride and head up the trail by the bathrooms.  East face of Goldy Boulder (first boulder on right after parking lot area Boulders).

content.description: Start on big jug arete, then follow the arete all the way.
content.location: Just to the left of Apollo on South face of the Goldy Boulder.  Downclimb/jump on North-East corner/arete.

content.description: Because this line follows a nice intrusion, it tends to stay cleaner than the offwidth and the face to the left of it. It climbs nicely, has cool sculpted holds, and a non-technical topout.
content.protection: pads, but you don't want to fall from this one up high
content.location: Just a couple feet left of the offwidth on the offwidth boulder. Look for rock that is a bit more solid, and nice holds that lead all the way up the wall.

content.description: Very nice line that cuts straight up the face in the middle of the flying carpet, and finishes with a straight mantel on fun edges. You'll grab a nice left hand pinch, and cool right hand sloper. As worthy as any line on the Goldy boulder, but less committing than the others.
content.location: Start sitting left of the rock under the downclimb, grab holds, left toe on the oblique ramp, and shoot up to a left hand sloper (crux), then finish straight up.

content.description: Start by standing on the smaller boulder to the left of Apollo.  Head up the face avoiding the faint aretes to either side.
content.protection: Pad if you can balance it on the awkward landing.
content.location: Face directly above the smaller boulder to the left of Apollo.

content.description: Balancy moves up the dihedral to the top. Fun!
content.location: This is the problem between aretes on the south side of the boulder.  Look at the beta photo for more info.

content.description: Follows the sharp and shallow features up the left side of The Offwidth Boulder. Another tall one.
content.location: Far left side of The Offwidth Boulder
